Interface KeyListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
ExampleKeyListener
public interface KeyListener
Interface to be implemented by any objects that require keyboard input.
KeyInput.java maintains a list of key listeners, and calls their keyPressed and keyReleased functions when an event is registered

In the constructor
Game.keyInput.addListener(this);

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
    keyPressed event that is called by KeyInput.java every time a keyPressed event is detected.
    void keyReleased​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
    keyReleased event that is called by KeyInput.java every time a keyReleased event is detected.

  • Method Details

    • keyPressed

      void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      keyPressed event that is called by KeyInput.java every time a keyPressed event is detected.
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent broadcasted by KeyInput

    • keyReleased

      void keyReleased​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      keyReleased event that is called by KeyInput.java every time a keyReleased event is detected.
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent broadcasted by KeyInput
